conversation.text: I'm in the mood for a horror movie. Could you recommend a few?

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text:
Certainly! Based on their request for a horror movie, I would recommend the following two movies:

1. "Get Out" (2017): This horror film directed by Jordan Peele stars Daniel Kaluuya as a young black man who finds himself at a mysterious plantation owned by his white family.

2. "The Conjuring" (2013): Directed by James Wan, this supernatural horror film stars Anne Hathaway and Tom Hardy as paranormal investigators, working to uncover the truth behind various supernatural events.

Both "Get Out" and "The Conjuring" are highly acclaimed horror films that have captured the imagination of audiences around the world.

  * Shutter Island - directed by Martin Scorsese, this film is based on the novel of the same name by Ted Chayver. The film tells the story of Edward Nakashima (played by Leonardo DiCaprio), a member of a mental institution called Shutter Island. Edward has been in isolation for five years and has no memory of the time he was away from his family.
  * Prisoners - directed by Jean-Pierre Melville, this film is based on the novel of the same name by Éric Sartre. The film tells the story of two men named Pascal (played by Michel Gabin) and Manès Arnauld (played by Jean-Pierre Melville himself), who have been friends since they were young boys.
